intro: Minuartia attica subsp. idaea, commonly known as the Greek rockcress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the rocky habitats of Greece. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically has hairy, succulent stems and leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. It thrives in well-drained, sunny environments and is adapted to withstand harsh, arid conditions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in alpine and rocky ecosystems.
